location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 8/78 II Sale of Gwadur to His Majesty's Government'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 12; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: This file concerns the question of whether the Sultan of Muscat and Oman [Sa‘īd bin Taymūr Āl Bū Sa‘īd] would be willing to sell or lease the territory of Gwadur [Gwadar] to the Government of Pakistan, with the British Government acting as an intermediary. The correspondence, which is conducted between the Political Agent and Consul at Muscat and the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bahrain, discusses how His Majesty's Government should advise both the Sultan and the Government of Pakistan on the matter.

name.namePart: Sultan of Muscat and Oman, Āl Bū Sa'īd Dynasty
